main

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Node

  • public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    Each Node has:
    • the elements to operate a binomial distribution
    • a list of all of its children Nodes
    • a score given to it by the process used for Q learning
    • a policy given to it from Q learning of the scores to every other Node
    • a unique state given to it by the process
    • a unique long Id
    Author:
    Cory Edwards

    • Constructor Detail

      • Node

        public Node(java.lang.Object givenState,
            long givenId)
        Create a new Node for a new state.
        Parameters:
        givenState - The state that does not have a node yet.
        givenId - The unique id for this node.

    • Method Detail

      • givePolicy

        public void givePolicy(gnu.trove.map.hash.THashMap<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Double> newPolicy)
        After Q learning has made all of the policies, it will give this Node its policy.
        Parameters:
        newPolicy - The given policy from Q learning.

      • getPolicy

        public gnu.trove.map.hash.THashMap<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Double> getPolicy()
        Every score for every other Node given this is the current Node obtained after Q learning. If a Node is not a child of this Node then its score will be 0. THashMap needs much less memory than normal HashMap, which is why it is used.
        Returns:
        Get the policy for this Node.

      • getMaxQScore

        public double getMaxQScore()
        Returns:
        The winning score obtained from Q learning.

      • getMaxQChild

        public long getMaxQChild()
        Returns:
        The winning child with the highest score from Q learning.

      • getState

        public java.lang.Object getState()
        Returns:
        The Node's unique state.

      • isNew

        public boolean isNew()
        To determine if this Node needs to be initialized or not.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the Node is new.

      • addOccurrence

        public void addOccurrence()
        Add 1 to n in the Node's binomial distribution.

      • addSuccess

        public void addSuccess()
        Add 1 to k in the Node's binomial distribution.

      • recalcProb

        public void recalcProb()
        Recalculate the probability that will be used in the Node's binomial distribution: (k / n)

      • giveProb

        public void giveProb(double newP)
        The programmer can use this to rather than automatically calculate the probability, they can give the Node its probability.
        Parameters:
        newP - The Node's probability.

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        Returns:
        The Node's score that was calculated when it was initialized.

      • setScore

        public void setScore(int givenScore)
        When the Node's is initialized, it will have to give a score to finish. When the score is given, it cannot be changed later. Calling this method more than once will not do anything.
        Parameters:
        givenScore - The Node's calculated score.

      • calculateProbability

        public double calculateProbability()
        Calculate the binomial probability of this node.
        Returns:
        The current probability from a binomial distribution.

      • getNodeId

        public long getNodeId()
        Returns:
        The Node's unique Id.
